item.title: BlackRock in Talks to Sell Stake in Sperry-Owner Authentic Brands Group
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- An investor group including CVC Capital Partners, General Atlantic, HPS Investment Partners and Leonard Green & Partners is in talks to buy BlackRock Inc.’s equity stake in Authentic Brands Group, according to people with knowledge of the matter. The firms — all existing investors in ...

item.title: BlackRock Stares Down FDIC Just Before Deadline Over Bank Stakes
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- BlackRock Inc. is resisting the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp.’s demands that the world’s largest asset manager submit to new oversight of its stakes in US banks, seeking to delay negotiations into the Trump administration. The FDIC had set a Jan. 10 deadline for BlackRock to sign an...

item.title: BlackRock Leaves Major Climate Group Amid Wall Street Exodus
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- BlackRock Inc. is parting ways with one of the world’s biggest climate-investor groups after being targeted by Republican politicians for its efforts on global warming. The money manager said Thursday in a letter to clients that it decided to leave the Net-Zero Asset Managers initiati...

item.title: Italy’s Eni Set for €3 Billion Asset Sales in 2025, UBS Says
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Eni SpA’s assets selloff plan is more than halfway completed and is far ahead of schedule, according to a UBS report on Thursday, adding that it expects the remaining disposals this year to be mostly focused on the upstream business. The Italian energy group has already sold assets f...

item.title: UBS Holds 2008 High as Kepler Sees $15 Billion Buyback to 2027
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- UBS Group AG cemented recent gains at 2008 highs as Kepler Cheuvreux SA said the lender can overcome concerns over higher capital requirements and distribute as much as $15 billion through share buybacks in the next few years. On Thursday, Kepler lifted its recommendation on the stoc...

item.title: UBS Set to Settle Credit Suisse US Tax Case, WSJ Reports
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- UBS Group AG is close to making a settlement in the hundreds of millions of dollars over violations by Credit Suisse of a decade-old agreement with the US Department of Justice related to tax evasion, the Wall Street Journal reported. The settlement could come as soon as this week, th...

item.title: Amundi, EDF Join Firms Asking EU Not to Water Down ESG Rules
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Some of France’s largest companies, including Amundi SA and Electricite de France SA, have signed a letter to European policymakers urging them to ensure the bloc sticks with its current timetable for implementing ESG reporting rules. The companies are responding to a growing wave of ...

item.title: Inflation Angst Can Be Harmful, ECB’s Cipollone Tells Corriere
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Excessive concern about possible future inflation shocks can be harmful to the economy, European Central Bank Executive Board member Piero Cipollone told Corriere della Sera in an interview. “Keeping demand low in an attempt to safeguard against future inflation shocks, is in my view,...
